Meet Linden. We're the newest inspiration on E. Burnside, just a hop skip and a jump from some of Portland's best places to eat, work and play. title: Perfect Urban Oasis in the Alphabet District! Two Bedroom Condo
postBody:
QR Code Link to This Post

Schedule your own showing automatically by clicking the green "Schedule Showing" button on our PropM website.

Neighborhood
Located in the classic Alphabet District, the historical Roosevelt Apartments are in the National Register of Historic Places and just steps away from all the action! Only seven units in this enchanting building. With a walk score of 97, this is truly a Walker's Paradise! The flat is walking distance to Trader Joe's, New Seasons, art house movie theater (Cinema 21), the best donuts in Portland (Blue Star) and of course one of the best shopping areas in Portland - 23rd St. Also extremely high transit scores. This area is bordered on one side by parks, and on the other side by the Willamette River.

Living Area
This coveted top floor condo has spacious rooms, open floorplan, updated, yet period details are abundant, such as stained glass accents, period details including large windows, arched doorways and built in nooks and crannies! Hardwood flooring throughout the apartment.

Kitchen
This delightful kitchen has been modernized and will provide enjoyment for the family chef with a beautiful blend of new and old! It includes stainless appliances, stained glass accents, period built-ins and details, attractive back splash and is filled with light from the oversized windows. Gas Range, Dishwasher and Garbage Disposal included. There is the original "automatic" wall telephone.

Bedrooms/Baths
Two spacious bedrooms and one updated bathroom. The bedrooms have oversized windows with master bedroom having large closet with built-ins. Second bedroom has a Murphy bed. This room can double as the perfect home office or hobby room. The bathroom features Marble and large walk-in shower with lots of built-in shelves and complete this beautiful and charming suite.

Exterior/Parking
Leaded pane doors lead to an enchanting deck which is full of light. Beautiful, serene treetop views. On lower level there is individual storage space for each unit. Street parking available.

Available Now for a one year lease with option to renew. Please contact us at 888.780.938 for additional information about this wonderful home or visit our website at www.PropMHomes.com to view current rental properties. We are the premier Portland Property Management Company.

title: Bright daylight basement Studio/1BR, garden view, quiet street
postBody:
QR Code Link to This Post

Recently remodeled, bright, daylight basement studio in the Ashcreek/West Hills neighborhood of SW Portland. Beautiful, interesting space, looks out onto garden. Has its own covered patio entrance, shielded from quiet tree-lined street, with zero crime statistics. Bike to Multnomah Village, ten minute drive to Hillsdale/Costco/ New Seasons, fifteen minutes to PCC Sylvania/OHSU/Lewis and Clark. #45 bus stops two blocks away. ~ 15 ft x 20 ft main room connects via short flight of stairs and landing to a tiny kitchen with a *half-sized* fridge, and through there to a large bathroom with a Jacuzzi-jet tub. Big, south-facing windows, nooks, ledges and an alcove make the (~ 450 sq ft) space efficient. There's also partially finished crawlspace adjoining the kitchen, accessible via step-stool, for storage. Includes three Ikea storage units, a small dresser and a fold-out desk/table with chair. Personal washer and dryer in the garage, abundant street parking. $900 rent includes utilities and fast WiFi. Large, shared back yard will occasionally be roamed by two miniature dachshunds and owner, who lives and works in the house above. No cats or smoking allowed. A calm, small dog just might be. References and background/credit check. Six-month lease. First month's rent and $1100 deposit to move in. Map location is approximate.

A note about the tall black thing in the kitchen photos: This is a spiral staircase and sort of a giant, obstacle, but it does provide shelving and visual interest, if you're into it. The landing at the top offers additional storage. Via the landing the staircase leads to the house above, but there's a door at the top that is kept deadlocked.

Note you're more likely to hear back if you don't just jump to asking if you can see the place, but instead tell me a little about your need for a place to live, whether you'll have references about being able to afford the rent, and on being trustworthy and a good tenant/neighbor. If you have an exceptional small dog you'll be wanting an exception for, please mention that up front, and consider whether a past landlord could vouch for your dog's own qualities as a tenant and housemate. Note single occupancy is recommended for the size and design of this place, as well as preferred and factored into the price.

P.S. This is a relisting and let me apologize if I did not respond to your inquiry or otherwise dropped the ball a couple weeks ago. I'd thought it would be available and view-able sooner, then later and now it should be available Aug 1. The current tenant mostly has his things boxed and says they'll be gone tonight or tomorrow.
